flow.mentorSays:
You are given the head of a singly linked list.

Your task is to reverse the list and return the new head.

Before we solve this, let’s be very clear.

A linked list is NOT an array.

Each element (called a node) contains:
• a value
• a reference to the next node

Reversing a linked list means:

1 → 2 → 3 → null
becomes
3 → 2 → 1 → null

We change the **direction of links**, not the values.

Let’s take a very small list:

A → B → C → null

After reversing:
C → B → A → null

Pause and think.

If you are standing on one node, what do you need in order to reverse its direction?

choices.label: Access to all nodes at once

flow.mentorSays:
Correct.

To reverse links safely, we must track:
• the current node
• the previous node
• the next node (temporarily)

We will use three pointers:

• prev → starts as null
• curr → starts at head
• next → used to store curr.next temporarily

Example walkthrough:

Initial:
prev = null
curr = A

Step 1:
next = B
A.next → null
prev = A
curr = B

Step 2:
next = C
B.next → A
prev = B
curr = C

Continue until curr becomes null.

When curr becomes null:

• prev will be pointing to the new head
• the list is fully reversed

Final check:

Input: 1 → 2 → 3 → null
Output: 3 → 2 → 1 → null

The list is reversed correctly.
